_header: I am beguiled of a wight that works me woe
Subjects: laments; lover’s lament; women, faithlessness of; love, unrequited
_description: Lament of the rejected lover — 37 lines in 6-line stanzas with an ‘O’ and ‘I’ refrain

ShrewsLib16329.First Lines:
y am by wylt of a wyȝt þat worches me woȝerfore
                    wemmen y warye in world ȝwer y go…
ShrewsLib16329.Last Lines:
…wyth an on & an y þys newe world wole gonno more
                    forster in freth no more lemmonfur fastene on þi flesch so fals forte
                    fonde…
ShrewsLib16329.Note:
Six stanzas with added lines in the second stanza and first line of a
                    seventh stanza.
ShrewsLib16329.Editions:
Cox,  D. C.,  and  Carter Revard.  
             “A New ME O-and-I Lyric and its Provenance.” 
             Medium Ævum
         54 (1985): 33-46: 38-9.
